Author: benhoyt
Content: Unless I'm badly mistaken, that site's much more than just a handful of days work.

Author: rustartup
Title: just occured to me - almost everybody do at least one startup per life
Content:
The start up that almost one do at least once per life is FAMILY:

-- starting with a low budget and wild emotions -- aiming at growth and public purpose -- changing its course as life goes on -- always focused on whats critical -- totally commited

No less than 2 co founders needed :)

Author: rms
Content: Yes, but they would have needed to invest more money to cover software and servers. Open source has come a long way since then.

Author: rms
Content:
Sign an NDA with everyone who you share the idea with?

I have an NDA drawn up you can have if you want it, email me.

Author: 7media
Content: but why are they using tapefailure? are they checking out what users type into the forms?

Author: euccastro
Content:
In this case I'm not sure that's a bad idea.

- This is, or should be, a very motivated audience.

- The point of the site is as much advertising yourself as seeking a cofounder as searching the current offers.

- The data you enter when you register is pretty much the search criteria for cofounders.
